content:
Sure, I can suggest some options for you!

- "Carrickfergus" by Loreena McKennitt: This is a traditional Irish song that prominently features the lever harp as the main instrument. It showcases the harp's delicate and haunting quality.

- "Claire de Lune" by Claude Debussy: This famous classical music piece is traditionally played on a concert harp, but there are also arrangements for lever harp that showcase the instrument's versatility.

- "Misty" by Erroll Garner: This jazz standard works well on the lever harp, as the instrument's delicate plucking can lend a introspective and moody feel to the piece.

- "The Water is Wide" by Ed Sheeran: This is a modern pop adaptation of a traditional folk song that prominently features a lever harp. It showcases how the instrument can be used in contemporary arrangements.

- "Atlantis" by Andrea Bocelli: This song is a blend of classical, pop and opera styles featuring both a lever harp and a concert harp. It highlights how the harp can blend seamlessly with other instruments and voices.

I hope these suggestions give you a good idea of the versatility of the lever harp!
